panels.description: Current health status of the equipment based on the latest analytics. Values range from 0 (critical failure) to 100 (perfect health). Green = Healthy (>70), Yellow = Warning (40-70), Red = Critical (<40).

targets.rawSql:
SELECT TOP 1
  Timestamp AS time,
  'Current Health' AS metric,
  HealthIndex AS value
FROM ACM_HealthTimeline_Latest
WHERE EquipID = $equipment
  AND $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
ORDER BY Timestamp DESC

panels.title: Current Health Status

panels.description: Time until predicted equipment failure based on Remaining Useful Life (RUL) analysis. Multiple prediction models contribute to this estimate. <0 hours means failure is imminent or already occurring.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT TOP 1
  LastUpdate AS time,
  'Time to Failure' AS metric,
  RUL_Hours AS value
FROM ACM_RUL_Summary
WHERE EquipID = $equipment
  AND $__timeFilter(LastUpdate)
ORDER BY LastUpdate DESC

panels.title: Predicted Time to Failure

panels.description: Statistical confidence level of the RUL prediction (0-100%). Higher confidence means more reliable prediction. Values >80% are considered highly reliable, 60-80% are moderate, <60% indicate high uncertainty.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT TOP 1
  LastUpdate AS time,
  'Confidence' AS metric,
  Confidence * 100 AS value
FROM ACM_RUL_Summary
WHERE EquipID = $equipment
  AND $__timeFilter(LastUpdate)
ORDER BY LastUpdate DESC

panels.title: Prediction Confidence

panels.description: Current risk level based on failure probability at the recommended maintenance window. LOW (<10% failure risk), MODERATE (10-30%), HIGH (30-60%), CRITICAL (>60%). Immediate action required for HIGH or CRITICAL.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT TOP 1
  CreatedAt AS time,
  'Risk Level' AS metric,
  CASE
    WHEN FailureProbAtWindowEnd < 0.10 THEN 0
    WHEN FailureProbAtWindowEnd < 0.30 THEN 1
    WHEN FailureProbAtWindowEnd < 0.60 THEN 2
    ELSE 3
  END AS value
FROM ACM_MaintenanceRecommendation
WHERE EquipID = $equipment
  AND $__timeFilter(CreatedAt)
ORDER BY CreatedAt DESC

panels.title: Risk Level

panels.description: Historical health score (solid blue line) with forecasted health trajectory (dashed line) and confidence intervals (shaded band). Shows 7 days of history plus 3 days of forecast. Declining trends indicate degradation.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  Timestamp AS time,
  'Historical' AS metric,
  HealthIndex AS value
FROM ACM_HealthTimeline_Latest
WHERE EquipID = $equipment
  AND $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
UNION ALL
SELECT
  Timestamp AS time,
  'Forecast' AS metric,
  ForecastHealth AS value
FROM ACM_HealthForecast_TS
WHERE EquipID = $equipment
  AND $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
UNION ALL
SELECT
  Timestamp AS time,
  'CI Lower' AS metric,
  CiLower AS value
FROM ACM_HealthForecast_TS
WHERE EquipID = $equipment
  AND $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
UNION ALL
SELECT
  Timestamp AS time,
  'CI Upper' AS metric,
  CiUpper AS value
FROM ACM_HealthForecast_TS
WHERE EquipID = $equipment
  AND $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
ORDER BY time

panels.title: Health Trajectory (7 Days History + 3 Days Forecast)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  Timestamp AS time,
  SensorName AS metric,
  NormValue AS value
FROM ACM_SensorNormalized_TS
WHERE EquipID = $equipment
  AND $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
ORDER BY Timestamp, SensorName

panels.description: Fused Anomaly Score (FusedZ) represents the overall anomaly severity combining all detectors. Values >3.0 indicate significant anomalies. Compare this with sensor deviations - if sensors deviate but FusedZ is low, the deviations are within normal operating patterns.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  Timestamp AS time,
  'Fused Anomaly Score' AS metric,
  FusedZ AS value
FROM ACM_HealthTimeline_Latest
WHERE EquipID = $equipment
  AND $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
ORDER BY Timestamp

panels.title: Fused Anomaly Score (FusedZ) Over Time

panels.description: Shows each sensor's current normalized value compared to its historical operating range (min/max). Sensors within their normal range (even if negative) are operating normally. Only values OUTSIDE the min/max bands indicate true anomalies.

targets.rawSql:
WITH LatestTimestamp AS (
  SELECT TOP 1 Timestamp
  FROM ACM_SensorNormalized_TS
  WHERE EquipID = $equipment
    AND $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
  ORDER BY Timestamp DESC
),
SensorStats AS (
  SELECT
    SensorName,
    MIN(NormValue) AS MinValue,
    MAX(NormValue) AS MaxValue
  FROM ACM_SensorNormalized_TS
  WHERE EquipID = $equipment
  GROUP BY SensorName
),
CurrentValues AS (
  SELECT
    SUBSTRING(SensorName, 1, 40) AS Sensor,
    NormValue AS CurrentValue
  FROM ACM_SensorNormalized_TS
  WHERE EquipID = $equipment
    AND Timestamp = (SELECT Timestamp FROM LatestTimestamp)
)
SELECT
  cv.Sensor,
  ss.MinValue AS [Historical Min],
  cv.CurrentValue AS [Current Value],
  ss.MaxValue AS [Historical Max]
FROM CurrentValues cv
INNER JOIN SensorStats ss ON cv.Sensor = SUBSTRING(ss.SensorName, 1, 40)
ORDER BY cv.Sensor

panels.title: Sensor Operating Ranges - Current vs Historical Bounds

panels.description: Top 10 sensors currently showing anomalous behavior based on latest OMR (Orthogonalized Multi-scale Regression) analysis. These are sensors deviating from normal patterns RIGHT NOW. Bar length indicates anomaly severity (z-score).

targets.rawSql:
WITH LatestOMR AS (
  SELECT TOP 1 Timestamp
  FROM ACM_OMRTimeline
  WHERE EquipID = $equipment
    AND $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
  ORDER BY Timestamp DESC
)
SELECT TOP 10
  SUBSTRING(SensorName, 1, 30) AS Sensor,
  ABS(OMR_Z) AS [Anomaly Score]
FROM ACM_OMRContributionsLong
WHERE EquipID = $equipment
  AND Timestamp = (SELECT Timestamp FROM LatestOMR)
ORDER BY ABS(OMR_Z) DESC

panels.title: Current Anomalous Sensors (Top 10)

panels.description: Top 10 sensors predicted to cause the next failure based on RUL attribution analysis. These sensors are DRIVING the failure prediction. Higher contribution % means higher impact on predicted failure. Compare with Current Anomalous Sensors to see if current problems match predicted failure causes.

targets.rawSql:
WITH LatestFailure AS (
  SELECT TOP 1 FailureTime
  FROM ACM_RUL_Attribution
  WHERE EquipID = $equipment
    AND $__timeFilter(FailureTime)
  ORDER BY FailureTime DESC
)
SELECT TOP 10
  SUBSTRING(SensorName, 1, 30) AS Sensor,
  FailureContribution AS [Failure Contribution]
FROM ACM_RUL_Attribution
WHERE EquipID = $equipment
  AND FailureTime = (SELECT FailureTime FROM LatestFailure)
ORDER BY FailureContribution DESC

panels.title: Predicted Failure Attribution (Top 10 Sensors)

panels.description: Probability of equipment failure over the next 7 days. Background zones: Green (<10% - Low Risk), Yellow (10-30% - Moderate Risk), Orange (30-60% - High Risk), Red (>60% - Critical Risk). When the line enters orange/red zones, maintenance should be scheduled urgently.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  Timestamp AS time,
  'Failure Probability' AS metric,
  FailureProb AS value
FROM ACM_FailureForecast_TS
WHERE EquipID = $equipment
  AND $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
ORDER BY Timestamp

panels.title: Failure Probability Forecast (7 Days)

panels.description: Recommended maintenance schedule based on RUL analysis and failure probability. Earliest Maintenance = absolute minimum time, Preferred Window = optimal time range to perform maintenance with lowest operational disruption, Failure Risk = probability of failure if maintenance is delayed until end of preferred window.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT TOP 1
  FORMAT(EarliestMaintenance, 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm') AS [Earliest Maintenance],
  FORMAT(PreferredWindowStart, 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm') AS [Preferred Window Start],
  FORMAT(PreferredWindowEnd, 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm') AS [Preferred Window End],
  FailureProbAtWindowEnd AS [Failure Risk at Window End],
  Comment AS [Recommendation]
FROM ACM_MaintenanceRecommendation
WHERE EquipID = $equipment
  AND $__timeFilter(CreatedAt)
ORDER BY CreatedAt DESC

panels.title: Maintenance Recommendation

panels.description: Breakdown of predicted failure type based on multi-path RUL analysis. Dominant Path indicates the most likely failure mechanism: Trajectory-based (gradual degradation), Hazard-based (event-driven failure), or Energy-based (accumulated stress). Each path provides an independent RUL estimate.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT TOP 1
  RUL_Hours AS [Consensus RUL (hrs)],
  RUL_Trajectory_Hours AS [RUL Trajectory (hrs)],
  RUL_Hazard_Hours AS [RUL Hazard (hrs)],
  RUL_Energy_Hours AS [RUL Energy (hrs)],
  DominantPath AS [Dominant Path],
  Confidence * 100 AS [Confidence %],
  Method AS [Analysis Method]
FROM ACM_RUL_Summary
WHERE EquipID = $equipment
  AND $__timeFilter(LastUpdate)
ORDER BY LastUpdate DESC

panels.title: Failure Type & Multi-Path RUL Analysis

panels.description: Recent trends for key sensor features over the last 24 hours, normalized to 0-100 scale for comparison. Each line represents a fast feature (statistical derivative like mean, std, energy). Rising or falling trends may indicate developing issues. Compare patterns here with Current Anomalous Sensors and Failure Attribution to understand failure progression.

targets.rawSql:
WITH TopSensors AS (
  SELECT TOP 10 SensorName
  FROM ACM_RUL_Attribution
  WHERE EquipID = $equipment
    AND FailureTime = (
      SELECT TOP 1 FailureTime
      FROM ACM_RUL_Attribution
      WHERE EquipID = $equipment
      ORDER BY FailureTime DESC
    )
  ORDER BY FailureContribution DESC
),
SensorData AS (
  SELECT
    omr.Timestamp,
    omr.SensorName,
    ABS(omr.OMR_Z) AS RawValue
  FROM ACM_OMRContributionsLong omr
  INNER JOIN TopSensors ts ON omr.SensorName = ts.SensorName
  WHERE omr.EquipID = $equipment
    AND $__timeFilter(omr.Timestamp)
),
Normalized AS (
  SELECT
    Timestamp,
    SensorName,
    CASE
      WHEN MAX(RawValue) OVER (PARTITION BY SensorName) = MIN(RawValue) OVER (PARTITION BY SensorName) THEN 50
      ELSE 100 * (RawValue - MIN(RawValue) OVER (PARTITION BY SensorName)) /
           (MAX(RawValue) OVER (PARTITION BY SensorName) - MIN(RawValue) OVER (PARTITION BY SensorName))
    END AS NormalizedValue
  FROM SensorData
)
SELECT
  Timestamp AS time,
  SUBSTRING(SensorName, 1, 30) AS metric,
  NormalizedValue AS value
FROM Normalized
ORDER BY Timestamp

panels.title: Sensor Feature Trends (Last 24 Hours - Normalized)

options.content:
# ðŸ“Š Equipment Health Monitoring Dashboard - Operator Guide

## Dashboard Purpose
This dashboard provides a comprehensive view of equipment health, failure predictions, and maintenance recommendations to help operators make informed decisions about equipment operation and maintenance scheduling.

---

## Understanding the Panels

### **Row 1: Critical Status Indicators (Panels 1-4)**

#### ðŸŸ¢ Current Health Status
- **What it shows:** Real-time health score (0-100%)
- **How to read it:**
  - **Green (>70%):** Equipment is healthy, normal operation
  - **Yellow (40-70%):** Warning - monitor closely, degradation detected
  - **Red (<40%):** Critical - immediate attention required
- **Action:** If yellow or red, check anomalous sensors and failure attribution panels below

#### â±ï¸ Predicted Time to Failure
- **What it shows:** Hours until predicted equipment failure (Remaining Useful Life)
- **How to read it:**
  - **Green (>168h / >7 days):** Safe operating window
  - **Yellow (72-168h / 3-7 days):** Plan maintenance soon
  - **Orange (24-72h / 1-3 days):** Schedule maintenance urgently
  - **Red (<24h / <1 day):** Critical - failure imminent
- **Action:** Use this to plan maintenance windows, cross-reference with Maintenance Recommendation panel

#### ðŸŽ¯ Prediction Confidence
- **What it shows:** Statistical reliability of the RUL prediction (0-100%)
- **How to read it:**
  - **Green (>80%):** High confidence - trust the prediction
  - **Yellow (60-80%):** Moderate confidence - monitor more frequently
  - **Red (<60%):** Low confidence - insufficient data or high uncertainty
- **Action:** Low confidence suggests need for more data or atypical operating conditions

#### ðŸš¨ Risk Level
- **What it shows:** Overall risk classification based on failure probability
- **How to read it:**
  - **LOW (Green):** <10% failure risk - routine monitoring
  - **MODERATE (Yellow):** 10-30% failure risk - plan maintenance
  - **HIGH (Orange):** 30-60% failure risk - schedule maintenance soon
  - **CRITICAL (Red):** >60% failure risk - urgent action required
- **Action:** This is your primary decision metric for maintenance urgency

---

### **Panel 5: Health Trajectory**
- **What it shows:** 7 days of historical health + 3 days of forecasted health with confidence bands
- **How to read it:**
  - **Solid blue line (left side):** Historical health score
  - **Dashed blue line (right side):** Predicted health trajectory
  - **Shaded band:** Confidence interval (wider = more uncertainty)
  - **Background colors:** Green zone (healthy), Yellow zone (warning), Red zone (critical)
- **Action:** Declining trends indicate progressive degradation; sharp drops suggest acute issues

---

### **Panels 6 & 7: Sensor Diagnostics**

#### ðŸ” Current Anomalous Sensors (Panel 6)
- **What it shows:** Top 10 sensors showing abnormal behavior RIGHT NOW
- **How to read it:** Bar length = severity of anomaly (z-score); longer bars = more severe deviation
- **Action:** These are the sensors currently acting up - investigate if multiple bars are long

#### ðŸŽ¯ Predicted Failure Attribution (Panel 7)
- **What it shows:** Top 10 sensors expected to CAUSE the next failure
- **How to read it:** Percentage = contribution to predicted failure; higher % = bigger driver of failure
- **Action:** Compare with Current Anomalous Sensors:
  - **If sensors match:** Current problems align with failure prediction - validate prediction
  - **If sensors differ:** Current anomalies may not lead to predicted failure - monitor both

---

### **Panel 8: Failure Probability Forecast**
- **What it shows:** Probability of failure over next 7 days
- **How to read it:**
  - **Green zone (<10%):** Low risk
  - **Yellow zone (10-30%):** Moderate risk - plan maintenance
  - **Orange zone (30-60%):** High risk - schedule maintenance
  - **Red zone (>60%):** Critical risk - urgent maintenance
- **Action:** If line enters orange/red zones, coordinate with Maintenance Recommendation panel

---

### **Panel 9: Maintenance Recommendation**
- **What it shows:** Recommended maintenance schedule with timing details
- **How to read it:**
  - **Earliest Maintenance:** Absolute minimum time before maintenance needed
  - **Preferred Window:** Optimal time range to perform maintenance
  - **Failure Risk at Window End:** Risk if you delay until end of window
  - **Recommendation:** Specific guidance from the system
- **Action:** Schedule maintenance within preferred window; avoid delaying past window end

---

### **Panel 10: Failure Type & Multi-Path RUL**
- **What it shows:** Breakdown of failure mechanism and RUL estimates from different analytical methods
- **How to read it:**
  - **Consensus RUL:** Overall best estimate (color-coded by urgency)
  - **Trajectory RUL:** Based on gradual degradation trends
  - **Hazard RUL:** Based on event-driven failure patterns
  - **Energy RUL:** Based on accumulated stress/fatigue
  - **Dominant Path:** Primary failure mechanism (TRAJECTORY=gradual, HAZARD=sudden, ENERGY=fatigue)
- **Action:** Use Dominant Path to understand failure type; if paths disagree significantly, uncertainty is high

---

### **Panel 11: Sensor Feature Trends (Last 24h)**
- **What it shows:** Recent behavior of key sensor features, normalized for comparison
- **How to read it:** Each line = a statistical feature (mean, std, energy, etc.); trends show changes over last day
- **Action:** Look for rapid changes or diverging trends; compare with anomalous sensors to understand issue progression

---

## Quick Decision Guide

### âœ… **All Green (Health >70%, Risk LOW, RUL >7 days)**
â†’ Continue normal operation, routine monitoring

### âš ï¸ **Yellow Warning (Health 40-70%, Risk MODERATE, RUL 3-7 days)**
â†’ Plan maintenance, monitor more frequently, review sensor diagnostics

### ðŸš¨ **Orange Alert (Health <40% or Risk HIGH, RUL 1-3 days)**
â†’ Schedule maintenance urgently, investigate anomalous sensors, prepare for shutdown

### ðŸ”´ **Red Critical (Risk CRITICAL or RUL <24h)**
â†’ Immediate action required, coordinate emergency maintenance, consider controlled shutdown

---

## Tips for Operators

1. **Check dashboard at shift start:** Review all 4 top KPIs first
2. **Monitor trends, not just values:** Declining health is more important than absolute value
3. **Cross-validate panels:** If current anomalies match failure attribution, prediction is more reliable
4. **Use maintenance window:** Don't wait until RUL hits zero - schedule within preferred window
5. **Low confidence = more monitoring:** When confidence <60%, check dashboard more frequently
6. **Note sensor names:** Features like `_mean`, `_energy`, `_kurt` are statistical derivatives, not raw sensors

---

## Need Help?
Contact maintenance team if:
- Risk level is HIGH or CRITICAL
- Health drops >20% in <24 hours
- Multiple sensors show high anomaly scores
- Failure probability exceeds 30%
- Prediction confidence is <60% and health is declining

---

**Dashboard Version:** 1.0 | **Last Updated:** 2025-11-29 | **System:** ACM V8 Autonomous Condition Monitoring

list.definition: SELECT EquipID AS __value, EquipName AS __text FROM Equipment ORDER BY EquipName
list.label: Equipment
list.name: equipment
list.query: SELECT EquipID AS __value, EquipName AS __text FROM Equipment ORDER BY EquipName

title: ACM Operator Dashboard - Equipment Health & Failure Prediction
